title: Midi Learn should be available for patch browsing.
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}]
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**

Some plugins, especially Arturia's plugins have a lovely patch browsing system which let you midi learn the next/previous preset buttons. This makes playing through banks of presets a joy. Easy and fun. For people with less than perfect eye-sight, also, a keyboard and or a midi shortcut for patch navigation would be a usability improvement.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

A.  Cursor Up/Down keys mapped to next/previous preset.
B.  Ability to right click on next and previous preset and click midi learn.


**Describe alternatives you've considered:**

There could be alternative ways to do this via some other way of setting up midi mappings, but midi learn would be the most clear and direct method.

**Additional context:**

This is not just a feature request it's a usability improvement for people with limited vision, and for people who are using Surge XT as a live instrument.

title: Modern retrig-from-zero sample offset
body:
The modern 2-point DPW algorithm uses points at phase, phase-d and phase -2d to calculate. This has the defacto one-sample latency effect (at the oversample sample rate).

This doesn't matter *except* in the retrigger-from-zero case when that shift makes the first output point at the wrong phase.

So in retrigger, intiialize phase to dphase, not to 0, so you can hit the zero point for symmetric waveforms exactly.

Addresses https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/937

title: Not updating LV2 control input ports upon program change in native UI
labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}, {'id': 3629789996, 'node_id': 'LA_kwDOCOvoes7YWjMs', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/LV2', 'name': 'LV2', 'color': 'CC8E59', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to the LV2 ports of Surge'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Surge does not appear to be updating its LV2 controller input ports
 upon program changes done from the GUI.

**Surge XT Version**
Surge XT 1.2.3.bb8dd2b

* Version: 1.2.3
* Plugin Type: LV2
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
In QTractor or MusE, open Surge's native GUI and the 
 corresponding QTractor or MusE generic GUI.
Now change program in Surge by selecting a program or clicking
 program up/down or category up/down.
Observe that all the native GUI controls correctly change to new positions
 but the generic GUI controls do not change at all.

**Expected Behavior:**
Generic GUI controls should follow what the native GUI shows
 after a program change initiated inside the native GUI.

**Screenshots:**

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: OpenSuse Tumbleweed
 - Host: Either QTractor or MusE
 - Version: QTractor 0.9.33 or MusE 4.1 release or latest master

**Additional Information:**
In LV2 lv2extprg.h, there is this statement (nearly identical to the old DSSI statement):
```
     * A plugin is permitted to re-write the values of its input
     * control ports when select_program is called. The host should
     * re-read the input control port values and update its own
     * records appropriately. (This is the only circumstance in which
     * a LV2 plugin is allowed to modify its own control-input ports.)
```
Trouble is, Surge does not seem to have any midi programs with which I can test
 that statement by selecting a program from within our host.
But also, this bug report is such that changing programs from within Surge GUI
 also does not appear to be updating its input control ports.
When we instantiate a UI descriptor, we pass a callback for the LV2UI_Write_Function argument.
Most LV2 synths seem to call this when a program changes via the GUI.
That lets us re-read the input ports and update our records.
But Surge does not appear to calling this upon program changes.

Meanwhile, Surge seems to be one of the only plugins to call the 'program_changed' callback
 in the _LV2_Programs_Host structure. 
This is good. 
But... Upon the 'program_changed' callback, when I examine all the input control ports
 so that I may update our records, none of the input ports have changed at all to reflect what 
 is now on screen in the native GUI.

Thus, it appears **impossible** for us to determine what is the new state of the on screen GUI controls
 after a program change from within the GUI, so that we may update our records.

This behaviour is seen in both MusE and QTractor.
Other synths tested do update the generic GUI controls after a program change from within the GUI.

Thanks.

title: Surge XT Effects Crashes when audio driver is Jabra Elite 75t
labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Surge Effects standalone briefly opens and then crashes when using Jabra Elite 75t bluetooth headphones. I'm not sure if this would happen with other bluetooth headphones. I don't have any on hand to test.

**Surge XT Version**
Surge XT Effects 1.2.3.bb8dd2b
2023-05-05

* Bitness: 64-bit arm

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Have the Jabra earbuds activated, connected, and set as the computer's audio output.
2. Play some audio. I was listening to something on Apple Music.
3. Click on Surge XT Effects to open it.
4. It will open for a little bit, and you will hear the sound change as the system audio gets rerouted(?). Then it will close, and probably cause an Apple crash report to be generated.

I think this has something to do with either this model of bluetooth earbuds or bluetooth audio in general, as the app works fine when system audio is set to laptop speakers. Switching to the jabras after the app has successfully opened does not cause the crash.

**Expected Behavior:**
Surge XT Effects opens and can be used.

**Screenshots:**
If applicable, add screenshots/GIF/videos to help explain your problem.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: 13.4.1 (c) (22F770820d)
 - Host: Standalone

**Additional Information:**

Snippet from crash report.

```
Thread 10 Crashed:: Jabra Elite 75t
0   Surge XT Effects              	       0x104f294c4 SurgefxAudioProcessor::processBlock(juce::AudioBuffer<float>&, juce::MidiBuffer&) + 1464

```

title: Turn off Midi PC Factory Backfill
body:
We initially made the unused banks fill in order
with Factory. We decided this was probably too volatile so just turned it off.

Doing so means in most cases midi program change does nothing so also remove the menu item for ignore midi program change.

Closes #576

title: Extend COMB size by 2x; Make extension cmake option
body:
1. The comb size is 2x larger allowing lower resonant physical modelling with the comb
2. Since this uses more memory, allow a build time flag to turn it off.  -DSST_FILTERS_COMB_EXTENSION_FACTOR=1 will revert to 1.2; =4 will give you even more modelling. =3 will crash and burn horribly. Pick a power of 2 if you use this!

Closes #7172

title: COMB_SIZE sample rate dependent
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1178865465, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY1NDY1', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Code%20Refactoring', 'name': 'Code Refactoring', 'color': '9155c6', 'default': False, 'description': 'General code refactoring and cleanup issues like names, unused variables, warnings, fixme'}, {'id': 1178867708, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY3NzA4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/DSP', 'name': 'DSP', 'color': 'e881ef', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth'}]
body:
`GetQFPtrFilterUnit` returns a `COMB_sse<COMB_LENGHT>` or `<EXTENDED_COMB_LENGTH>` in an if already

but that `COMB_LENGTH` means at 96khz sample rate your bottom comb frequency is about 93hz

so

1. Modify sst-filters so getfqptrfu takes a same rate
2. Fix the tests and examples
3. Modify the 4 calling points in surge and upgrade the submodule
4. Modify the calling point in surge-rack and upgrade the submodule
5. Document the change so other users if they exist who pull can see the difference

title: MIDI Program Change Support
body:
Addresses #576

I might even go as so far as to say we are done with #576 with this commit but I'm sure there will be comments and changes still. So here's how it works

1. We add a new directory %USER%/Patches/MIDI Programs
2. We add a new data structure `patchIdToMidiBankAndProgram[128][128]` which for a bank and program is used for a patch id
3. We populate it as follows

   a. If `MIDI Programs` has top level patches those become bank 0 b. If `MIDI Programs` has directories, those fill in order. So a just-directories MIDI programs has bank 0 as the first directory and a mix and match has bank 0 as the raw top level and bank 1 as the first directory c. If there's still banks to be filled we fill them one at a time from factor. So if you have 6 directories in MIDI Programs, bank 7 will become 'Basses' (the first factory)

By 'fill' we mean traverse the category in alphabetical order and set the patches as programs, up to 128

Banks with < 128 patches don't respond to PCH for the empty slots
Categories with > 128 patches only map the first 128

title: Please allow use of custom simde location
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1571077334, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTcxMDc3MzM0', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Infrastructure', 'name': 'Infrastructure', 'color': '0c2a6d', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to repository, CI/CD, installers, etc.'}]
body:
VCV Rack decided to go with simde for SSE compat under ARM, and Cardinal is following that (while initially using sse2neon instead).
Due to differences on the version shipped with Rack vs the one shipped with surge, there can be symbol conflicts.
Doing an LTO shows this message:

```
../include/simd-compat/../simde/simde/x86/sse2.h:136:3: error: type 'union simde__m128i_private' violates the C++ One Definition Rule [-Werror=odr]
plugins/surgext/surge/src/../libs/simde/simde/x86/sse2.h:124:3: note: a different type is defined in another translation unit
  124 | } simde__m128i_private;
      |   ^
../include/simd-compat/../simde/simde/x86/sse2.h:95:38: note: the first difference of corresponding definitions is field 'neon_f16'
plugins/surgext/surge/src/../libs/simde/simde/x86/sse2.h:94:38: note: a field with different name is defined in another translation unit
   94 |     SIMDE_ALIGN_TO_16 float32x4_t    neon_f32;
```

A possible solution is to be able to use a custom simde version, alike done with juce.
That should be the approach for surge-rack too IMO, since the library is already provided by the Rack SDK modules built against VCV Rack should use it instead of their own custom version.

Alternatively the built-in simde could be contained in a custom namespace, but not sure how much work that is..

title: A new "wide" UI mode that presents all 3 oscillators onscreen simultaneously
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1178866610, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY2NjEw', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UI', 'name': 'UI', 'color': '963715', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to UI look&feel'}, {'id': 1862967420, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODYyOTY3NDIw', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Skinning%20Engine', 'name': 'Skinning Engine', 'color': 'd3ffaa', 'default': False, 'description': "Issues related to Surge's skin engine"}]
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**

My only problem with Surge is being able to only see a single oscillator onscreen at once. Surge is a fabulous synth but I find myself often avoiding using it because of slow access to oscillators. It's not that switching between oscillators is so slow, but I feel like I'm always worried about what's on the other oscillator page. I find it's a kinda "stressful" UI because of the oscillator switching. Surge would be so much cooler if you could relax and just look at one page. I think it's a design priority problem that we have access to 8 macro slots yet access to the oscillators is more limited.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

It would be really great if there could be a new "wide" UI mode that presents all three oscillators onscreen simultaneously. This could help to make Surge more hands-on friendly. I realize there would be more onscreen but looking at three oscillators instead of 1 is not that difficult, and perhaps a new skin could color code background areas of the different synthesis sections.

title: Build wheels for surgepy with cibuildwheel
body:
Use cibuildwheel to build wheels (compiled binary Python packages) for surgepy. Wheels can be built locally by running
```
    $ pipx run cibuildwheel --platform linux src/surge-python/
```
in the surge repo (if pipx and podman are installed). More info on cibuildwheel [here](https://cibuildwheel.readthedocs.io/en/stable/).

Also do not link surgepy with the system libpython when building the surgepy Python package. This allows using the built wheels with multiple Python interpreters. The pybind11 docs recommend not linking against libpython for this reason; more info [here](https://pybind11.readthedocs.io/en/stable/compiling.html#building-manually).

No CI changes here, just changes to make cibuildwheel runnable locally.

labels: [{'id': 1218170928, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMjE4MTcwOTI4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Modulation', 'name': 'Modulation', 'color': 'c97f2a', 'default': False, 'description': 'Modulation related issues'}, {'id': 1829061756, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODI5MDYxNzU2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UX', 'name': 'UX', 'color': '42d9f7', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
The "Freeze" parameter in the Nimbus effect cannot be modulated by a scene envelope. Confusingly, ED was able to actually make it work and even send me a patch where it is modulated, which I could load! However, myself and at least one other person confirmed that we weren't able to do it on our systems!

**Surge XT Version**
Latest nightly

* Version: Latest nightly
* Plugin Type: standalone
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Load template "Init Saw"
2. Add Nimbus effect to first FX on chain A.
3. Click on "S-LFO 1". Change it to the template "Basic ADSR".
4. Set D to 1 second, S to 100%, every other slider to 0.
5. Try to drag and drop it onto the "Freeze" slider. Does not work. (It can successfully be dropped on any other parameter.)

**Expected Behavior:**
Freeze parameter is modulatable.

**Screenshots:**
N/A

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Host: Standalone

**Additional Information:**
N/A

title: Dump current settings to a HTML file
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 3293667621, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwzMjkzNjY3NjIx', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Accessibility', 'name': 'Accessibility', 'color': '50BF51', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to making Surge more accessible'}]
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**

It would be nice to have a quick way to review settings for patches without the need to tab and arrow through everything for keyboard users.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

A button or menu choice to export the control names and settings for the current patch to an HTML file that reflects the interface groups of controls, but with headings and bulleted lists. For example, Seen 1 would be a heading 2, Osc 1 would be a heading 3, and so on. Perhaps it would even be possible for the feature to open the browser to this file.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**

I considered either talking and recording the settings I have found or typing them into a file.

**Additional context:**

I know we could also simply save patches and give them to each other, but this feature would speed up looking through settings for people who only use keyboard who are blind, and even prevent accidental changing of parameters, although leaving the warning on about not over-writing the patch is also a good thing to keep active.

title: Help Tags For Controls
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}]
body:
I'd like to be able to get quick help on what controls do and a little about how they work in one or two susinct sentences. This would help with quick learning and reminders for new people such as I am. Otherwise, I have to open up the manual and lose my workflow, and the manual is huge.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
I'm a Mac user. VoiceOver has a handy key that reads help tags, so that would be so cool to be able to use.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
I've thought about cutting bits from the manual and putting the content into a smaller file, but that would also be a workflow interruption. 

I've also tried Shift-F10 and going to the manual, but I land at the top of the manual, and am unsure exactly where to look for the feature for which I need help.

title: Expose tuningApplicationMode in surgepy
body:
Add `SurgeStorage::TuningApplicationMode` enum to surgepy using pybind11's enum_. Expose `tuningApplicationMode` in surgepy with pybind11's def_property.

In Python `tuningApplicationMode` can now be accessed as
```
    >>> import surgepy
    >>> s = surgepy.createSurge(44100)
    >>> s.tuningApplicationMode
    <TuningApplicationMode.RETUNE_MIDI_ONLY: 1>
```
and set as
```
    >>> s.tuningApplicationMode = surgepy.TuningApplicationMode.RETUNE_ALL
```

title: Different patches play different scale degrees with retuning
labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Playing midi note zero with the `Keys/DX EP.fxp` and `Basses/Bass 1.fxp` patches gives different pitches when using retuning (tuning files used below).

**Surge XT Version**
I used surgepy built from commit [21bfcdb](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/commit/21bfcdbb0b907bee7db5dcce61c3a7b7ad0c9094) in the surge repo.

I also tested with Surge XT in Reaper:

* Version: Surge XT 1.1.makepkg.d3568a9ae
* Plugin Type: LV2
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
I've created a temporary repo with a surgepy script, the tuning files, and the output I get [here](https://github.com/narenratan/tuning_example).

To reproduce, running
```
$ git clone https://github.com/narenratan/tuning_example.git
$ cd tuning_example
$ python3 tuning_example.py
``` 
loads the tuning files and plays midi note zero using the DX EP patch, producing `dx_ep.wav`. Changing `patch_name` in the script [here](https://github.com/narenratan/tuning_example/blob/main/tuning_example.py#L19) plays midi note 0 with the Bass 1 patch, producing `bass_1.wav`. Listening to the two wav files, `bass_1.wav` has a pitch a major third below `dx_ep.wav`. This corresponds to the `5/4` in the scl file [here](https://github.com/narenratan/tuning_example/blob/main/example.scl#L9); changing the 5/4 moves the pitch Bass 1 plays (the DX EP pitch remains the same).

I also saw this behaviour in Reaper by:
- Creating a new project and track
- Adding Surge XT to the track FX
- Setting the patch to DX EP
- Loading the [scl](https://github.com/narenratan/tuning_example/blob/main/example.scl) and [kbm](https://github.com/narenratan/tuning_example/blob/main/example.kbm) files 
- Adding the Midi Sequencer Baby before Surge XT
- Setting the sequencer to loop midi note 0 and playing the track
- Switching between the DX EP and Bass 1 patches

This leads to the pitch moving by a major third when I switch between the patches

**Expected Behavior:**
I would expect that the pitches produced when using the DX EP and Bass 1 patches would be the same. In particular the DX EP pitch is the one I would expect.


**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Linux (Arch Linux)
 - Host: Python and Reaper
 - Version: Python 3.10, Reaper v6.69

**Additional Information:**
This is a minimal example of something I ran into when using retuning with a just intonation sequencer I am working on. Using different patches for different parts in a song was changing the pitch of some parts. I made the scl and kbm files above with Scale Workshop to be safe.

title: Make surgepy an installable Python package
body:
Hi Surge Synth Team,

Thank you for Surge! I've been using Surge in a command line just intonation sequencer I'm writing in Python, so Surge's tuning support and Python API have been super useful :)

It would be handy for me to be able to include surgepy as a dependency for my project, so I had a look at packaging it as a Python package. It turns out there is a tool [scikit-build](https://scikit-build.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) specifically for packaging Python extensions built with CMake. In case it would be of interest, this PR is to make surgepy installable as a Python package using scikit-build. It's based on the scikit-build pybind example project [here](https://github.com/scikit-build/scikit-build-sample-projects/tree/master/projects/hello-pybind11).

With this branch you can run
```
python3 -m pip install <REPO_DIR>
```
on the surge repo to build and install surgepy as a Python package. I've used this to install surgepy in a Python virtual environment to use for development.

Also I've built a Python binary wheel for surgepy so I can install it without building it every time. I tested installing the wheel in a Ubuntu VM and it works. Using wheels it would be possible to create a surgepy package on PyPI so people could `pip install surgepy` and it would just work.

Thank you again for Surge!

title: Properly zero out Oneshot I16 padding
body:
When building a one shot we pad with 3 extra tables. Those tables get zero values in them. BUT the zero table for the I16 mipmap has an FIR extension and our zeroing didn't zero this out. This meant that if you load a wave as oneshot (but not a wt which would be correctly streamed) then save and unsave, you could get boogers in the end of the last frame. Nothing w ecan do about people who streamed in the past but this will fix it going forward.

Closes #6573

title: Implement Stereo or Mono noise in Wide mode
body:
in Wide mode noise can either be mono or stereo based on the deform on the noise colour (on the RMB menu).
Make a type, handle streaming with it missing, etc... you know the drill.

Closes #6494

title: Implement CLAP_NOTE_CHOKE properly
body:
Implement choke as

1. Do a release in case the note isn't released; then
2. Find the voice and do an uber-release

This seems to work great in the bitwig drum machine. When we have more choke clients we may need to revisit it.

Closes #6332

title: Invalidate all params etc... on patch change
body:
A patch change can change the name or value of any param. So when it happens send the maximal updateHostDispolay (excluding latency). Trigger this with a new patchChanged atomic on the synth which we set to true at the end of the off-thread load. Results in bitwig showing all correct param changes on patch change in vst3 and presumably other compliant hosts would do same.

Closes #6607

title: An optional off-by-default Twist LPG Fix
body:
See issue #6760 and https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/766

The Twist LPG implementation used an incorrect block size so decayed too quickly. There's probably a correct patch to plaits to not decay with size 12 (around line 208 of voice.cc) but for now make it correctable optionally so we can correct it in rack.

title: Remove unnecessary jassert about note id used for Clap note expressions

body: The jassert for non -1 note id isn't necessary, Clap doesn't prohibit note expressions from being per note id.

title: XY cutoff/res control in filter analysis pane
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1829061756, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODI5MDYxNzU2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UX', 'name': 'UX', 'color': '42d9f7', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.'}]
body:
as discussed on discord:

Would be in the words of baconpaul a "cute idea" to allow clicking on the filter analysis window to control cutoff on the X axis and resonance on the Y axis.

this lets you tweak both params simultaneously with a mouse, turns a previously display-only part of screen into a control surface, and would provide the pretty satisfying experience of really dragging around the cutoff point and resonance peak directly on the curve.

title: Modify SpringReverb to compile AVX2
body:
Sprint Reverb throws an compile error AVX2 because __m128 isn't direct convertible to VecType which is a juce::SIMDVector thingy. SO make an explicit VecType and load it instead

Closes #5993

title: Fix code quality
body: I accidentally merged the last install when azure was down thinking it was good. It wasn't. Now it is.

title: Storage Configuration API
body:
As we get more clients of SurgeStorage (tests, rack, etc..) a single constructor API is becoming a bit limiting, so make a structure API point on construction which defaults to the SurgeSynth style

WHile implementing add

1. dont-make-user-dir option and
2. extra-thirdparty-wavetables option

title: Replace the original set of Templates with some that are CC0-licensed.
body:
Init Saw and Init Sine were created by @baconpaul and posted on Discord.

Also add CC0 `Luna/NES Triangle` wavetable that was used in `Init NES Triangle WT`.

edit: I also want to state for the record that I do not recommend the actual use of `Init Alias NES Triangle` (or indeed Alias at all) to create chiptune as it has a DC offset and produces inharmonic aliasing which is not accurate. `Init NES Triangle WT` should be more accurate for this purpose.

title: Fix a Lanczos Resampler problem
body: in https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/commit/66dde24b20c498335e57820088b4679c781fd7a1 I accidentally introduced a bug in the resampler used for twist when having neagive offsets to supress a warning about an unsigned compare incorrectly. Remediate.

body:
Which otherwise prints through the whole
submodule chain and would still be triggered
when used as a submodule in a submodule in Rack

title: Make surge-testrunner fail if resources not positioned
body:
Current surge-testrunner has some tests which assume the runner is run from CWD=root of surge (so "resources/" is a good local reference). We should probably fix that one day maybe

But for now make it error out if a candidate test file isn't there but since you can select single tests and they work, also give an env for workaround.

title: Use the defaulted copy and assignment constructors, instead of memcpy
body:
, for parameters in SurgeSynthesizer.

Starting with just this file, rather than a full replacement, to ensure that everything is good with the outcome here before I change everything else.

The generated assembly code before called memcpy. Afterwards it seems to inline the copy constructor and assignment operator, using registers to move the data. I know gcc can fall back to memcpy for trivial classes, so I believe it's choosing not to do that here.

title: Commence updating C-style string usage to std::string
body: Addresses #6730

title: Clean up some maybe-uninitiqilized variables
body: Closes https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/697

title: Fix C string usage leading to buffer overflow in LTO builds
body:
See https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/690 for the discussion around it.
Only saw crashes happening with Cardinal using surge-xt modules built with LTO enabled, might be LTO uses a custom `snprintf` ?
Not exactly sure, but updated code looks good (and better/proper) to me.

title: Last few changes for turning off bits and bobs
body:
1. Turn off uneeded juce formats
2. Include the riscv and wasm JUCE changes from falk

title: Allow a SURGE build without any libMTS
body:
Adding the cmake option -DSURGE_SKIP_ODDSOUND_MTS=TRUE means that surge will not consume an libMTS code and will not present users the MTS options. The default build settings include MTS so if you want an MTS free surge, you need to actively set the option.

See the discussion in #6724

title: Allow to skip oddsound-mts usage
body:
From what I could understand, the oddsound-mts library is only partly open-source.
All the code from https://github.com/ODDSound/MTS-ESP references a system library that must be loaded at runtime.
There is no public code for libMTS.so

I even suspect this is a GPL violation, the MTS client code is directly calling a proprietary library and Surge is using MTS client code. Would need a deeper investigation..

For now I would appreciate a way to disable this feature, I was surprised to find there is a reliance on an external library from a plugin (even if optional)
There is likely more stuff needed, but my knowledge of cmake is very lacking so I just did the code.

title: Disable unwanted/not-needed sqlite features
body:
The built-in sqlite has all default features enabled, we can remove some that are unused.
Specially important is the "load extension" which uses dlopen/dlsym/dlclose/etc, these are superfulous and introduce extra library links (libdl.so on Linux) without being needed.

The other ones I picked based on a quick check through the code, these seem to me the more obvious ones to take out.

title: Allow building for RISC-V and Web-Assembly
body:
Using simde we can enable RISC-V builds.
Depends on https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/sst-plugininfra/pull/37

title: Fix build with mingw
body: The function `_BitScanReverse` also exists in mingw, and was causing a build failure for surge-xt in Cardinal.

title: Make modulation on Ring Modulator effect Unison Detune parameter work
body: Closes #6714

title: Ring Modultor Unison not modulatable
labels: [{'id': 2152171733, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTUyMTcxNzMz', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Effects', 'name': 'Effects', 'color': 'ff38f8', 'default': False, 'description': ''}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
the RM FX detune isn't modulatable

The reason for this is

```
if (fxdata->p[rm_unison_detune].absolute)
        {
            dphase[u] = (storage->note_to_pitch(*f[rm_carrier_freq]) * Tunings::MIDI_0_FREQ +
                         fxdata->p[rm_unison_detune].get_extended(
                             fxdata->p[rm_unison_detune].val.f * detune_offset[u])) *
                        sri;
        }
        else
        {
            dphase[u] =
                storage->note_to_pitch(*f[rm_carrier_freq] +
                                       fxdata->p[rm_unison_detune].get_extended(
                                           fxdata->p[rm_unison_detune].val.f * detune_offset[u])) *
                Tunings::MIDI_0_FREQ * sri;
        }
```

We use `fxdata->p[].get_extended` which is fine but use it in `fxdata->p[].val.f` which is the value, not the modulated value.

Replace that with 

```
 storage->note_to_pitch(*f[rm_carrier_freq] +
                                       fxdata->p[rm_unison_detune].get_extended(
                                           *f[rm_unison_detune] * detune_offset[u]))
```

in both places.

title: Add an AirWindows Build Time OptOut
body:
Surge VST would never want this but since we don't currently include the AW FX in Surge XT for Rack, the build isn't needed. So stub out to be a single NoOp effect so the FX will still work just do nothing.

Addresses https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/652

title: String Oscillator Alloc Tweak
body:
The string oscillator assumed that `init` was only called once per instance, so checked out a delay line from the pre-allocated pool in init. But if init was called twoce it would check out again but not return first.

In surge proper this doesn't matter since we in-place new a new instance for each voice on. but in rack where we make external retriggers available it did; this manifested itself as a string oscillator leak in rack

The delay lines are pre-initialized to null so simply check if they are null before accessing from the memory pool and this fixes the rack leak

title: Surge standalone hangs on launch on Mac
labels: [{'id': 1701279657, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNzAxMjc5NjU3', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Awaiting%20User%20Information', 'name': 'Awaiting User Information', 'color': '0ec994', 'default': False, 'description': 'Self-explanatory'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}, {'id': 2833394235, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyODMzMzk0MjM1', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Cannot%20Reproduce', 'name': 'Cannot Reproduce', 'color': 'ff0000', 'default': False, 'description': "Issue that cannot be reproduced on our side, or user doesn't have a consistent reproducible case"}]
body:
Surge standalone hangs on launch on my Mac. 

Version: Surge XT 1.1.2.d3568a9
Build: 2022-11-01 @ 14:28:23 on 'Mac-1667312250086.local/pipeline' with 'AppleClang-13.0.0.13000029' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: macOS 64-bit AU on Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-9880H CPU @ 2.30GHz
MacOS 13.0 (22A380)

When I double-click on the Surge XT icon in Finder, the Surge icon appears in the Dock and soon starts jumping up and down, and it gets labelled "not responding" in Activity Monitor. No GUI appears. "Force quit" is the only way to stop it.

Surge works fine, however, as an AU plugin in Ableton Live 11 (which is where I copied the version info from).

title: Change for RACK ARM build
body: RACK ARM adds a flag we don't need to our compile which isn't used but we compile with werror and unused compile flag is an error so supress that.

title: Add a "Pitch" and "Env" output slot on TreeMonster
body: TreeMonster C++ class gets an output slot for the smoothedpitch and for the envelope tracker. This is consumed by VCV Rack modules

title: Correct the Analog ADSR
body:
1: Add a correct (matches digital) implementaiton of ADSR
2: Make it available in a switch, off by default in surge proper

title: Merge in S(m)exoscope
body:
This imports the s(m)exoscope code and modifies it to work with our own system and JUCE.

Only thing missing is the readout on click (you can see the old code for it #if'd out). Could use some UI love as well, as it looks pretty ugly right now. But as far as I can tell it's functional.

Parameters for the scope currently do not save. It would be kind of nice if they did.

title: Fix WT-length-one clamp error
body:
In recent versions we allowed wavetables of length one but when doing so missed this clamp which resulted in hi < lo. that is UB (but defacto clamped to low) but that inversion triggers an assert on some configurations.

So (1) add a debug assert to our limit range and (2) use a max of 0 on the upper bound.

Closes #6702

Chessel  Today at 5:10 PM

Hi all.  I have a suggestion to aid usability for keyboard users - the typing keyboard that is.  If I set up a parameter with modulation, could the LFO controls region switch to showing that modulator?  So if I add a modulator to my osc 1 pitch using voice 1, if I then alt full stop to the LFO controls region, it should be on the voice 1 controls.  If I then added a filter, and modulation of the cut off frequency with voice 2, and I go to the LFO controls, it would have shifted to the voice 2 controls.  So whenever I set up a new modulation the focus of the LFO controls region shifts to show that modulator.  This would save having to go to the modulator region to select the LFO.

baconpaul  Today at 5:15 PM

oh so like "add modulation from lfo1" in the menu selects lfo1?
that's a bit of a pain for the signted ui since that menu is meant to allow you to add modulators from "away" sources while looking at "current" sources. but i see why you want it.

Chessel  Today at 5:16 PM

Yes. Exactly.

baconpaul  Today at 5:17 PM

OK let me drop it in a github issue

title: Drag and drop does not work in reaper Linux.
labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
Reaper v6.64, linux mint 20 64 bit. surge xt 1.1.2. Present in both vst3 and lv2.

Trying to drag and drop a file into wavetable sample does not work. Nothing happens, surge doesn't seem to see the sample at all as the sample is actually loaded into the project when you drag the sample on to surge.

title: Add an optional LFO onepole for FROM_LAST envelope mode
body:
In envelope mode with high deform in FROM_LAST mode the signal from the envelope is not continuous. This is basically unsolvable analytically - the deform plus state is too hard - and so leave it on by default but add an optional one pole to smooth it out, which may be useful in some cases.

Expose configurations of that to the rack LFO

Addresses https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/607

title: It would be nice to have an oscillator for one shot samples.
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}]
body: While it is not necessary since we have audio input, having to rely on the audio input means we can't package sounds that use samples as presets. Surge is an ideal synth for creating drum sounds, the only issue is it's a bit of a bother to layer in noise and attacks and so on.

title: More control over the input/output of the filters and the ability adjust filter mix
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}]
body:
The only thing that makes me reach for vital over surge, despite vital being very resource hungry and preferring the character and tone shaping options in surge, is the fact that we have so little control over the routing and mixing of the filters. This is a limitation that greatly affects some physical modeling(esque) processes that would otherwise be possible, for example:

Kalimba: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MGfL5dQee9M

Harp and bowed string: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LgNEvGVFz9Y

Flute: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wVul3xKs7xA

These kinds of processes would be very cool to explore with the audio input of feature of surge! Another cool feature idea would be the ability to route the effects before the filter and distortion.

title: Fix an attack/delay phase problem with FROM_LAST
body: As outlined in https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/601

title: Add the ability to specify a frame-size for untagged wav
body: If the wav doesn't have a frame size tag, we default to one shot. This adds an optio on the WT you can set pre-load to offer up a default wavetable size. It is used in the "Load WaveEdit Wavetable" option in XT Rack only right now

title: Update WT Category Sort
body:
"EMU VSCO/Foo" would come after "EMU" and "EMU VSCO" but before "EMU/Bar" since " " < "/". This meant jog order at the end of EMU was wrong.

Fix it by doing a pathe-element-wise compare

Will fix https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/585

title: LFO Retrigger: Release during attack
body: LFO Retrigger for release during attack would fail to scale properly also.

title: Add new VKB related actions for keyboard shortcut mapping
body: Partially relates to #6688

title: Allow LFO Envelopes to retrigger from non-zero values
body:
This diff allows LFO envelopes to retrigger from non-zero values when either attacking or just envelope retriggering. It compensates for deform and envelope LFO cases also.

It defaults to being FROM_ZERO, the current surge behavior, and does not activate the new behavior in surge VST. Surge XT Rack will end up turning this on before the 1.0 release though.

title: [RFE] On Linux, changing the name of the binary "Surge XT"
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}]
body:
On Linux, the custom is not to have spaces in the name of the executable file because it causes all sort of problems especially when you want to use it in a script or when you use completion in a terminal. Also the use of upper case letters is not very frequent.

Perhaps you could consider to change the name of the file "Surge XT" by something like "surge-xt" or "surgext".

title: Virtual keyboard shortcuts configuration
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1829061756, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODI5MDYxNzU2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UX', 'name': 'UX', 'color': '42d9f7', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.'}]
body:
In Surge XT, the shortcuts configuration could be enhanced.

Example 1: The Surge XT manual precises: "Note: Some actions in Surge XT are done by doing Alt + Drag or scroll wheel. On certain Linux distributions, those shortcuts and gestures may cause conflicts between Surge and the desktop environment. We decided we couldn't give up alt-drag for all platforms because one window manager in one distribution used it by default. Therefore, it's often possible to disable that global gesture in desktop environments, and would be the easiest way to solve that possible issue."

In fact, when we use a desktop environment and other applications with their own requirements, wo don't always want to change our shortcuts for just one application, even if it is Surge XT that we love a lot!

On Linux, the key "Alt" in Surge could be changed by the "Windows" key for example but it should always be a user choice.

Example 2: On my desktop environment, the "Shift + F10" does not work and this combination can't be changed in the shortcuts configuration panel while it is an important shortcut.

Example 3: How can we configure the keys of the virtual keyboard? By trials and errors, I discovered that "}" and "c" are my keys to change the octave, that "a" give a C note, and so on. Perhaps i could be configured somewhere but I didn't found where.

Example 4: Some people use DVORAK or other keymap that fits their needs. All the shortcuts often needs to be configured to have a pleasant experience.

Long live to Surge XT! 


Configuration: Debian Linux, XFCE desktop environment, BPO keymap.

labels: [{'id': 1218170928, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMjE4MTcwOTI4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Modulation', 'name': 'Modulation', 'color': 'c97f2a', 'default': False, 'description': 'Modulation related issues'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}, {'id': 3879582117, 'node_id': 'LA_kwDOCOvoes7nPbml', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/CLAP', 'name': 'CLAP', 'color': 'F120E8', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to CLAP plugin format'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Surge XT publishes parameters for per-channel modulation in the Clap plugin version. However those don't actually currently work per channel.

I can see a couple of ways to handle this :

1) Make Surge not publish parameters as supporting the per-channel modulation. Not preferable but at least hosts could avoid in that case showing any per-channel modulation options for the user.
2) If possible, make the parameters actually work so that the Clap note event channel is taken into account.

**Surge XT Version**
Latest nightly

* Version:
* Plugin Type: Clap
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10/Mac Os
 - Host: Custom host

title: EG graphical editable ADSR points
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1829061756, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODI5MDYxNzU2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UX', 'name': 'UX', 'color': '42d9f7', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.'}]
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**
The ADSR of the EG seems to me a poor design of Surge's filters compared to other very intuitive settings.
Other synths use a graphical view in which you can drag with the mouse the ADSR points.
For example see Exakt Lite 

https://www.sonicbits.com/exakt-lite.html

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
It would be great if we could click the current EG graph and a bigger windows pops up with a Exakt Lite's similar bigger graph with editable (with the mouse) ADSR points so users can choose not to use the 4 sliders (which I don't think are user friendly controls here). Also immediate feedback in the graph is seen (which is now according to my understanding much harder to see in this small graph).
Maybe the ADSR sliders can be replaced completely in the future by this method?

title: request: linux appimage
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}]
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**
I see there is a DEB and RPM file made for linux. Not being a Linux expert, but I really enjoy the comfort and ease of an appimage, see:

https://appimage.org/

For example I use it for LMMS.

https://lmms.io/

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
Maybe it's a good idea to provide an ampimage for Linux?
See the LMMS project as an example.
It would be also very handy for testing nightly builds since you don't need to install the appimage to run it.

title: feature request: standard/advanced mode
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}]
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**
I think everybody agrees Surge XT is becoming a synth swiss army knife of features which is good, but it's also a bit bad for beginners.
Why? Because it gets overwhelming when you want to learn then basic synth concepts. There are so many options it's hard for beginners to see the 'big picture' of how a synth works at basic level. I'm a beginner myself and I'm learning Surge myself by 'ignoring' the most advanced features (just to not have too much concepts to understand all at once) and then slowly learning those too, when I know the basics.


**Describe the solution you'd like:**
I would like to' request a feature that can set Surge into standard or advanced mode.

Standard mode allows changing the most basic features so Surge can be used as a learning tool for people wanting to learn digital synths or for people not needing the more advanced features. But Standard mode should make certain advanced options unavailable (disable the menu item or button so it requires not much code changes and the user just can't click it) so beginners are not 'lost' in the ever growing amount of features. 
Maybe limiting the number of parallel things too (or number of LFOs, ...)

Advanced mode should be Surge XT as it is now: all options and features enabled.

What does the dev team think of this?

title: manual: Dutch translation
body:
Hi!

I'm a woman speaking Dutch as native language.
I'm interested in translating the surge XT manual to Dutch.

However I have no knowledge of html, tools, compiling documentation, websites, ... 
So I only can use a text editor or a program like LibreOffice

Is there a way I can translate the text and provide the team with a LibreOffice document containing the translated text, so you can convert it to the right format to put online (like the English version)?
I will put in all pictures too and respect all paragraphs of the text, so you can exactly see where the text is located and it can be copy-pasted very easy for the person who will put it in the desired format.

Ps: please note I'm autistic and need VERY clear instructions on how to do this correctly (I mean the format to use for the translation. The translation itself is no problem as I have good English knowledge).
As a consequence of my autism, I don't like to go into chatboxes like Discord (real-time chat) so going to surge's Discord server is not an option for me.
So I prefer contacting on github here or if anybody wants to help me personally by email (to get me up-and-running) that's OK too.

Ps 2: I have a very strong dedication when I'm doing something. This means I want to keep updating my translation for updates.
Unfortunately I never worked with github and don't know how to do a PR, ... I'm actually a bit scared of doing something wrong.
If it's possible, I would like to give my translation here as an attachment so a contributor can submit it in the correct way.
Maybe if it's easy to do this on github (I never used github), I can try to do it myself.

So that's why I ask if somebody can 'guide' me here so I can contribute to this wonderfull project by translating the manual to Dutch.

Thank you
Lien

title: Tag Support expanded in a couple of ways
body:
1. Shift-Save adds a tag field
2. Tag field gets saved and restored consistently
3. tag field injected into sql db
4. Tag field used in plain text search in sql

labels: [{'id': 1503110050, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTAzMTEwMDUw', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/FM%20Enhancements', 'name': 'FM Enhancements', 'color': 'd2a9fc', 'default': False, 'description': ''}, {'id': 1538896939, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTM4ODk2OTM5', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Experimental', 'name': 'Experimental', 'color': 'ff3da1', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to experimental features that may or may not see the light of day'}, {'id': 2877964229, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyODc3OTY0MjI5', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Discussion', 'name': 'Discussion', 'color': 'd0c509', 'default': False, 'description': ''}]
body:
...correct? Borked? Hard to say. 

But this is true: (sine old fb x) - (sin new fb 2 x) = 0
Or in other words the new one gives exactly the same result as the old at half the percent value. 

In FM2 and 3 this is not true. The new and old modes never subtract to silence. 

Investigation needed.

title: Add Tone Circle to Radial
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1178866610, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY2NjEw', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UI', 'name': 'UI', 'color': '963715', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to UI look&feel'}, {'id': 1505910927, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTA1OTEwOTI3', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Tuning', 'name': 'Tuning', 'color': '027039', 'default': False, 'description': 'Non-standard tuning extensions'}]
body:
Scala and Entonal offer a Radial Dial where the notes appear at their distance from each other whereas Surge's radial has notes equally apart based on the number of notes per scale while showing their deviation from equal. As per a discussion on Discord there was interest in having this Scale Tone circle feature added to Surge.

Currently the Radial dial in Surge appears as follows 

![Screenshot_20230808_211100](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/41337033/b33129ae-415e-45e3-8b51-7c119460a05b)

For the same tuning, Scala offers this variation:
![Screenshot_20230808_211001](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/41337033/1652c36a-2916-4ee5-aee6-118fcee38b31)

Same tuning for Entonal displays with this style:
![Screenshot_20230808_211213](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/41337033/26d0c713-5f10-43d4-9986-2e84bd4eff40)

The tuning for reference:

```
! 17 Tone 5 5ths down 4/3 generator.scl
!
17 Tone 5 5ths down 4/3 generator
 17
!
 256/243
 65536/59049
 9/8
 32/27
 8192/6561
 81/64
 4/3
 1024/729
 262144/177147
 3/2
 128/81
 32768/19683
 27/16
 16/9
 4096/2187
 243/128
 2/1
 ```
 
As for the display, having both the fractions (or cents) for the notes (as per Entonal) as well as the distance between the notes in cents (as per Scala) would be ideal.

title: Tuning Editor functionality in MTS Client Mode
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1505910927, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTA1OTEwOTI3', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Tuning', 'name': 'Tuning', 'color': '027039', 'default': False, 'description': 'Non-standard tuning extensions'}]
body:
Currently if Surge is in MTS-ESP client mode the Tuning Editor is dormant and not reading data

The request is to have Radial and True Keys provide scale information as it would if Surge was playing from a loaded .scl file

As per our discussion on Discord:

True Keys display would require:

1: The currently pressed keys
2: Their frequency
3: The ability to subtract and take a log 

*Since we show actual keys not scale tones. We have all of that in MTS mode

The Radial display would require:

1: The currently pressed key
2: The scale tone for each of those keys
3: The repetition interval of the scale
4: Their frequency
5: The ability to subtract and take a log

*We are missing 2 and 3 in the MTS api but have it in the tuning library

Surge window will start to corrupt graphics by rendering almost everything black, until all the monitors are black.

To not bug out rendering.

None

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Linux Mint
 - Host: None
 - Version: Latest

**Additional Information:**
nvidia-driver-525
Geforce GTX 750 Ti
Geforce GTX 1050 Ti

I'm pretty sure no other programs, including games break rendering like this so I wouldn't have a clue why surge does this.

title: SF2 oscillator type
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}]
body:
Would it be feasible to add soundfont SF2 as an oscillator type into Surge XT ?

Since discovering Swami Project ( http://www.swamiproject.org/ )  on my linux system, having lots of fun creating my own soundfonts & playing with existing soundfonts.
Although maybe dated, the open soundfont format is  very powerfull, almost endless possibilities for making professional sounds & presets from short wav files into a single sf2 file ! 
Wav files can be looped, played once, layered ect, would be super to be able to combine this with surge XT's synth features.

Thank you Surge team for all superb instruments !

title: CLI OpenSoundControl works
body: The CLI has a separate process loop so it needs to make sure to call processBlockOSC().

title: Osc freqnote
shared_ptr<float[N]> workaround
body:
C++17 allows a `shared_ptr<float[N]>` but earlier doesn't. Thats fine we are C++17 but rack compiles with such an old version of the OSX SDK that it doesn't have the appropriat econstructor in place. We could do a bunch of ifdefs to fix this but instead, just make the type `shared_ptr<float>` in this case and adjust the constructor to have a custom [] deallocator.

Addresses #7116
Addresses https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/904

title: The CLI Issue
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1571077334, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTcxMDc3MzM0', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Infrastructure', 'name': 'Infrastructure', 'color': '0c2a6d', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to repository, CI/CD, installers, etc.'}, {'id': 3300191311, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwzMzAwMTkxMzEx', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Standalone', 'name': 'Standalone', 'color': 'd4c5f9', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues pertaining to Surge standalone application and CLI (command line interface)'}]
body:
With https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/commit/1c86f31caffdd8f57a29e240db263ecbd233e3e0 we introduced surge-xt-CLI. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GqATdng9y9A

So what's to be done still?

- [x] Include it in installer
    - [x] zip file all platforms
    - [x] macos embedded in standalone
    - [x] deb
    - [x] rpm
    - [x] win64 maybe? maybe not?
- [x] sample rate, buffer size as arguments
- [x] use default audio device if nothing specified 
- [x] consistency check on command line arguments
- [x] bind all midi option
- [x] stopping condition 
- [x] output channel (right now on device we bind to output 0,1 only - that's the nasty bitset
- [x] inputs? Do we want to bother
- [x] add to manual

comments below as we go. thanks

title: Add Mute scene option in context menu of scene Volume parameter
Skeleton for a CLI Build
body:
This is the skeleton for a JUCE CLI version of Surge-XT, which will allow zero gui command line intiiated standalone sessions (a "headless player").

Right now it doesn't do much. This commit is to put the plumbing in place and frankly make sure it builds in CI!

title: CLAP moved CMake min from 20 -> 21; track that
body: but since surge requires 20, track it by excluding clap

title: Alert has its own Focus Traverser
body:
Alert doesnt' subclass Overlay. That's fine but as a result it participates in main window focus. Change it so it has its own keyboard traverser.

This mostly solves the 'wander into other ui' problems but I still get the patch browser in my keyboard list so its not complete. Merge to make nightlies better for ally users tho

Addresses #7089

title: Windows on CLang
body: Add a windows-clang build to CI. If it works, we will swap the release pipeline also. Addresses #7004

title: OSC: fixed floating point OSC output formatting
Fix up locale apis
body:
1. Remove the unused but incorrect ScopedLocale
2. Move float_to_clocalestr to UnitConversions
3. Fix includes etc...
4. Leave one place at stream since it is very hard to test and has worked for years.

Closes #7095

title: Cleanup locale spread
labels: [{'id': 1178865465, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY1NDY1', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Code%20Refactoring', 'name': 'Code Refactoring', 'color': '9155c6', 'default': False, 'description': 'General code refactoring and cleanup issues like names, unused variables, warnings, fixme'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
Over time the code has 3 ways to deal with locale

1. set `::locale` globaly and printf. UnitConversions.h. Bad. Global and not thread safe
2. `std::imbue` a `std::ostream`. Medium. Local and thread safe but old threads API. Grep for std::imbue
3. `fmt::format(std::locale::classic(), "{:L}", value);`. What we want

Moreover, we don't have a regtest to stream and unstream a patch in a non-standard charset. May be tricky to write.

But anyway just a reminder to clean this up some as it popped up doing OSC.

body: Added OSC output and many new messages are understood and sent.

title: Menu Bold Fonts use the Bold Typeface
body:
Bold fonts in menus used `getPopupMenuFont().bolden()` which in some cases on macOS renders improperly for our TTF font but we aren't sure why. We already ship the LatoBold font TTF with surge, so instead add a `getPopupMenuFontBold` API point which uses that TTF and adjust calling code to use that rather than font.bolden

My theory is this will address #7021 but lets leave it open until we get confirmation from a user.

1. FX Swap didn't particpate in Undo. It does now (with a full patch stream which is the best we can do)

title: Crash when left-click, drag & holding Mojo FX and dropping onto itself on a certain preset.
labels: [{'id': 1829061756, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODI5MDYxNzU2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UX', 'name': 'UX', 'color': '42d9f7', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.'}, {'id': 2152171733, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTUyMTcxNzMz', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Effects', 'name': 'Effects', 'color': 'ff38f8', 'default': False, 'description': ''}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Dropping the Mojo FX onto itself will cause Reaper to crash when on a specific preset.

**Surge XT Version**
This information is found on the About screen, which you get to from the bottom right menu.

* Version: 1.2.0.cb11acd
* Plugin Type: VST3
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. 1st select the 'Slowboat > Rhythms > Bellish Shape Shimmer' preset from the 3rd party section.
2. Look for the Airwindows Mojo FX on the Global FX 2 slot at the end.
3. Left-click, drag and move the FX box slightly, and then release so it drops onto the same spot (onto itself).
4. Reaper will then crash.

**Expected Behavior:**
There should be no change to the FX or slot when dropping onto itself, and there usually isn't.

**Screenshots:**
N/A.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10 Home
 - Host: Reaper
 - Version: 6.80

**Additional Information:**
This doesn't happen on the initial patch.

title: Bonsai, Chorus and __restrict
labels: [{'id': 1178865465, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY1NDY1', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Code%20Refactoring', 'name': 'Code Refactoring', 'color': '9155c6', 'default': False, 'description': 'General code refactoring and cleanup issues like names, unused variables, warnings, fixme'}, {'id': 1178867708, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY3NzA4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/DSP', 'name': 'DSP', 'color': 'e881ef', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth'}, {'id': 2152171733, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTUyMTcxNzMz', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Effects', 'name': 'Effects', 'color': 'ff38f8', 'default': False, 'description': ''}]
body:
```
diff --git a/src/common/CMakeLists.txt b/src/common/CMakeLists.txt
index 1996fc19..196df2ee 100644
--- a/src/common/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/src/common/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -317,6 +317,7 @@ elseif(UNIX)
     target_link_libraries(${PROJECT_NAME} PRIVATE execinfo)
   endif()
   target_link_libraries(${PROJECT_NAME} PUBLIC surge::simde)
+  target_compile_options(${PROJECT_NAME} PUBLIC $<$<CXX_COMPILER_ID:GNU>:-Werror=restrict>)
 elseif(WIN32)
   target_compile_definitions(${PROJECT_NAME} PUBLIC
     WINDOWS=1
```

will make bonsai fail to build on gcc with a thousand errors and Chorus with one

We need to be careful either removing restrict or having in-place versions of operations.

body:
With the new vkb we bind `]` to extended keyboard but that key is also accessible key for menu open so right now any action with accessible on that opens a menu also plays a key. So

1. why? Why doesnt the event get eaten and why does it go to the vkb. Is it keypress vs scan keybed
2. If we cant answer that de extend the keyboard if the key edits are on and
3. If we cant do a that make a narrow vkb binding which activates when key edits are on 

or some such. But gotta sort it out!

body:
**Bug Description:**
When I modulate a DLY FX parameter, I see random memory rendered in the bottom line of the hover text.
Patch attached.
[Handbells Dev 2.005.fxp.zip](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/files/11848511/Handbells.Dev.2.005.fxp.zip)


**Surge XT Version**
Version: Surge XT 1.3.nightly.605b717
Build: 2023-06-05 @ 22:22:33 on 'WIN-9J4PM7PJGLL/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.29.30148.0' using JUCE 7.0.5
System: Windows 64-bit VST3 on Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700HQ CPU @ 2.80GHz
Host: Cakewalk by Bandlab @ 44.1 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples


**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. While editing Scene B [might not be relevant], create a delay in FX slot G2.
2. Arm a macro.
3. Modulate the Mix [or any] parameter of created DLY.

![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/13245475/a8220324-293d-4608-942d-6d784fbcbe56)

When you click on the slider to modulate, the hover text shows memory junk, where I expect to see the possible range of the applied modulation.

**Expected Behavior:**
I expect to see the possible range of the applied modulation.

**Screenshots:**
![image](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/13245475/f239bebb-8915-4596-bc75-0c9beee865ce)

**Additional Information:**
Likely a mistyped variable, bad pointer, or old string, where the text is composed?

title: OSC improvements: patch loading, OSC output (path of loaded patch)

Enhancements to OSC:

Patch changing via OSC is working, including full path specification, patch incr/decr, category incr/decr, and random patch change.

OSC output has been added. The first (and only, so far) message reports the path for patch changes.

All patch and tuning file paths have been made consistent in excluding file extension from OSC messages. They are added contextually in OSCListener.

title: Fix a LIVE feedback bug
body:
Live sends me VST3 param events when dragging with a value different from my slider, which causes a feedback loop. Supress those write events when editing.

Addresses #6648

title: oscillator parameter sliders snap to a different value when first touched
body:
1. Add a fresh instance of Surge XT
2. Set OSC1 to any type
3. Try and adjust an OSC parameter with the mouse
4. Some of the parameters will suddenly snap to a different value (from the default) as soon as the left mouse button is pressed

Particularly, this always happens with FM2 and FM3 Feedback, causing me great distress as it goes from 0% to -396% immediately, but I also found it occurs with most parameters in all oscillators, for example, all parameters of the String oscillator snap to some other value from what they were initially, except for Pitch. The values they snap to don't appear to be entirely consistent (other than FM2/3's remarkably consistent -396% Feedback) (nvm this time it snapped to -270% idk)

By setting the oscillator type to reset the sliders, this bug seems to reset and can be retriggered again, although some, like FM2/3's Feedback, would be seemingly cured and won't snap again until I initialize a new instance of Surge XT.

Doesn't appear to occur with any sliders outside of the OSC section.

Version: Surge XT 1.1.1.ecf7fe6
Build: 2022-08-25 @ 21:56:20 on 'WIN-KDGQ3UVP6AT/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.29.30146.0' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Windows 64-bit VST3 on Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6100 CPU @ 3.70GHz
Host: Ableton Live 11 @ 44.1 kHz

Waveform/Spectrum was all uppercase, we don't do that on multibuttons.
Waveform/Spectrum would always flip the scope mode, regardless of multibutton value.
Label and grid drawing tweaks

title: cmake stuck at "building juceide"
labels: [{'id': 2877964229, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyODc3OTY0MjI5', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Discussion', 'name': 'Discussion', 'color': 'd0c509', 'default': False, 'description': ''}]
body:

title: Show modulation of parameters (to give visual feedback how the Modulation Source is changing the Destination)
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}]
body:
Hi,

here is a Feature Request: Visualize the modulation of parameters as value changes of the sliders in modulation mode (= middle mouse click). 
Objective: This would give immediate visual feedback how the Modulation Source is changing the Destination, and which Destinations are changed by the Source..

_Example:
So, e.g. if the Cutoff slider is set to ~C5, and the Cutoff slider has a as modulation source LFO1, which is set to sine, bipolar and 1 Hz rate and 100% left/right (13 Hz/25000Hz). The grey/green line should move accordingly from full left/ full right to the center, back and forth._ 

Kind regards, 
Peter

title: Oscillator Shaping
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1178867708, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY3NzA4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/DSP', 'name': 'DSP', 'color': 'e881ef', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth'}]
body:
Over in https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/303 user posted super useful ideas about PD and stuff which since they were in the rack repo we didn't consider properly.

Tagging @Kwurqx  and moving the content here and closing that issue as we move to rack xt.

-------------
Even more oscillator wave shape shaping control would be great.

More flexible "shaping" options for the oscillator shape will give you countless custom waveshapes (with their own tuneable spectra). A great addition to (custom) wavetables, that have their own pro's and con's (e.g. finding/selecting/building them).

Surge already has several (many!) great oscillator shaping functions. Surge also already has the slider controls to control the shaping amount. And these slider are also a modulation targets. All great! But it could be even better!

Even some extra "simple" squeeze/stretch transformations in the Horizontal (Time) and Vertical (Amplitude) domain are great.

Maybe add extra shape distortion curves/functions as a modulator for the oscillator shape in time and/or amplitude domain. Or even allow custom shapes (via editor or import). Or even dynamically shapeable shaping shapes....

Anyway...

Of course there are infinite possibilities in Wave shaping shapes and functions. Even when just applying this to the amplitude domain. Sort of companding/distortion of the amplitude (vertical) domain of the wave shape. A common wave shaping/distortion function). Already implemented in Surge in some forms / signal path stages.

But of course this can also be applied to the time (horizontal) domain. Surge already offers this in some form too. With the right shape/function you can achive something "simple" as "PWM" of say an symmetric SAW into a asymetric SAW. By companding/distoring over the time domain. To visualize: where the zero crossing is shift left, compressing anything left of the zero crossing, expanding anything to the right.

Since the time domain is revlevant for both frequency and phase, you could als modulate phase to distort/shape a wave. Some words on that below in the "special" bit on FM/PM/PD.

In general, you can apply any wave shaping curve at any amount to the time and/or amplitude domain of the oscillator wave shape. Added control over the Oscillator Shape Wave Shaping curve (in the Oscillator section) would be great to. Some edit functions would be tops. But some clever presets would be great too. Or some "wavetable" like option, where you can morph between fixed shapes?

Random link to amplitude shaping

https://www.testandmeasurementtips.com/basics-of-amplitude-distortion-faq/
Some "special" waveshaping functions that might deserve a seperate feature request: Phase Distortion

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phase_distortion_synthesis
Peavy/Casio Phase Distortion.

"non-cyclic" shaping functions
https://theproaudiofiles.com/phase-distortion-synthesis/
Yamaha "FM" phase distortion wave shaping

phase modulating a 0 Hz carrier as offered by e.g. Yamaha SY77/99.
16 operator/modulator "cyclic" operator/modulator waveshapes
There have been some Korg implementations of FM/PM/PD too: Variable Phase Modulation (e.g. Prophecy, Z1). Trying to avoid the Yamaha FM patents.

Bowl of mixed fruit on FM/PM/PD:

https://www.perfectcircuit.com/signal/phase-distortion-frequency-modulation

body: Private is dumb anyway. But for enums it is really dumb!
