labels: [{'id': 1178866610, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY2NjEw', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UI', 'name': 'UI', 'color': '963715', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to UI look&feel'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Filter Analysis Window: Visualization does not move when Cutoff/Resonance is changed via CC (MIDI learn with + external Midi controller)

**Surge XT Version**
* Version: 1.1.1
* Plugin Type: VST3
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open Surge XT as VST3 in Cakewalk by Bandlab
2. Assign Cutoff  to MIDI Controller (e.g. CC 118) via MIDI learn
3. Open Filter Analysis Window
4. Try to change Cutoff via MDII controller, result: The cutoff slider moves, but not the visualisation in the Filter Analysis Window 
(ps. The frequency visualisation in the Filter Analysis Window moves when i move the cuoff slider with the mouse)

**Expected Behavior:**
 The frequency visualisation in the Filter Analysis Window should also move when cutoff is changed via external CC/MIDI controller. 

**Screenshots:**
If applicable, add screenshots/GIF/videos to help explain your problem.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Host: Cakewalk by Bandlab
 - Version: 9/2022

**Additional Information:**
 Its a Notebook with Intel Graphic Card.


Thank you for this great synth and for having a look at this issue.

BR; Peter

title: Smooth 60FPS operation for the Oscilloscope
body:
This should make the Oscilloscope much smoother (60 FPS!), at barely any hit to CPU.

**PLEASE VERIFY, BEFORE MERGING THIS, THE CHANGE IN OverlayWrapper.cpp**. I noticed that OverlayWrappers were not set to opaque. This meant that everything that partially intersected with some OverlayWrappers would get repainted at the same rate that the (non-opaque?) children get repainted. This is a big CPU hit as like 10+ sliders get repainted at 60 FPS. I'm not sure if not making OverlayWrapper opaque was intentional or not, so please verify before merging this PR.

title: Tear-outs hide in Reaper on MacOS
labels: [{'id': 1829061756, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODI5MDYxNzU2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UX', 'name': 'UX', 'color': '42d9f7', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
When tearing our the filter analyzer, MSEG etc etc, those windows take on what I'd call a "never-on-top" behavior. They are always behind the Surge UI window, whether the latter is pinned or not. 

EDIT: So there turns out to be a few related issues here. One was that the pin button was missing. This is adressed by #6634.

The other issue is that when neither window is un-pinned, the tearout windows are always-behind the main Surge UI window. Obviously window focus usually determines which window goes on top. 
This is especially annoying because it means pressing the tear-out button apparently just makes the window in question dissappear. At which point one has to move the main UI out of the way to be able to access the pin button so the tearout can go on top. Not very useful. 

In less problematic but probably related news, both windows pinned also doesn't correctly follow the last-focused-window-on-top paradigm.

title: Make oscillator display semitransparent if it's muted
App fails to start when USB misconfigured
labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}, {'id': 3300191311, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwzMzAwMTkxMzEx', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Standalone', 'name': 'Standalone', 'color': 'd4c5f9', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues pertaining to Surge standalone application and CLI (command line interface)'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
After connecting to and selecting a (somewhat flakey) external usb device then quitting, removing that connection and restarting, got a hard crash (even after plugging external speakers back in.

**Surge XT Version**
1.1.0.012f6ce

* Version:
* Plugin Type: [VST2, VST3, AU]
* Bitness: [32-bit or 64-bit]

**Reproduction Steps:**
Will be hard to reproduce probably, but this was my path:

1. Selected a (somewhat flakey) external usb device in options.
2. Quit.
3. Unplugged from external audio jack (not device itself) -- perhaps this is what created bad state? 
4. On launch, hard crash. Removing that connection and restarting and changing sound options in system prferences did not fix.

**Workaround**

 I was able to fix by going into /Users/{username}/Library/Application\ Support/Surge\ XT.settings  and just deleting the VALUE audioSetup::DEVICESETUP (but most users wouldn't know to do this).

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Mac 12.6
 - Host: Stand alone

**Additional Information:**

Thread 5 Crashed:: USB Audio

title: Fix crash/assert with sge->effectChooser->currentClicked being -1
body:
On Linux.

`sge->effectChooser->currentClicked` cause an assert on `cfxtype = sge->effectChooser->fxTypes[cfxid];` is it is `-1` (build with assertion on like it is the default for the flatpak). This on opening the standalone version or opening the UI on the LV2. (not sure about the VST3).

title: Surge's control changes at preset loading don't refresh hosts' corresponding knobs or values.
labels: [{'id': 1829056442, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODI5MDU2NDQy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Host%20Automation', 'name': 'Host Automation', 'color': 'fbca04', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to DAW (host) automation'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
If you load a new preset with SurgeXT's preset loader, no values refreshed in host. It seemed first time like a takeover issue, but it's basically just this: no automation "actual" value, nor GUI knobs on host side refresh to their real value when you load a new preset. The big impact on my workflow is: I have a default preset saved for SurgeXT in Ableton Live. Surge's 8 macro knobs are made to show up as first 8 controls on live's little plugin GUI at bottom of the screen (Opening VST controls with [>] button on it and pressing Configure just to move Surge's controls to show up on Push 2's knobs. When you load a new preset in Surge, Live's GUI "Macro1..8" controls stay greyed at previous presets' last value and instantly jump there when you start to move given Push knobs. They are rotary encoders showing actual values on screen. This behavior completely destroys this simple use case.

**Surge XT Version**
Version: Surge XT 1.1.1.ecf7fe6
Build: 2022-08-25 @ 21:56:20 on 'WIN-KDGQ3UVP6AT/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.29.30146.0' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Windows 64-bit VST3 on Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-4150 CPU @ 3.50GHz (Windows 10)
Host: Ableton Live 11 @ 44.1 kHz

**Reproduction Steps:**
Ableton live 11, change to midi clip view on Surge's track (Shift+Tab from device view), switch to envelopes view (two dots connected backslash form, Alt+2), move any of Surge's controls (one is enough), switch/load preset in Surge, watch that parameter changing on Surge's GUI and not changing on Live's GUI.
My use case: Switch to Device view (Shift+Tab from Clip view), open Surge's extended view on it with little triangle button pointing down/right. Press Configure button, it stays active. Move any controls on Surge GUI, watch them appearing on Live's Device view, Switch off "Configure" mode, and load a new preset in Surge. None of them will move. When you move any of them, their corresponding controls on Surge will jump to that wrong value first.

1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '...'
3. Scroll down to '...'
4. See error

**Expected Behavior:**
Please give the host your controls new state when required! Especially on preset load.

**Screenshots:**
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Q0YGVp2dTx6391n3MdCbsGKhF3zkZjQw?usp=sharing

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Host: Ableton Live 11
 - Version: 11

**Additional Information:**
Push2's knobs are practically unusable after Surge preset load (even when loading partial presets with that hamburger menu like button)

Edit: typo

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. e.g. I'm always frustrated when [...]
Surge's noise is stereo only. In some situations it would be useful to switch from stereo noise to mono.
**Describe the solution you'd like:**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
The oscillator is mono and when I use the noise it is always stereo. One button to switch from stereo to mono to mono to stereo solves many situations.
**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
It would be useful to create a noise button. Or even two buttons. One stereo and another mono.
**Additional context:**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

Thanks to the team!

labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Parameters that should not be/won't work as per note/id modulatable, will show up as such.

**Surge XT Version**
1.1.1 nightly, Clap

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. In a host that supports per note modulation of parameters, you will see parameters like "A Scene LFO 1 Rate" or "Oscillator N octave" as such, but those either don't make sense (because they target scene level parameters) or don't work (because they are integer parameters which can't be modulated in Surge as of now).

**Expected Behavior:**
The Clap parameter flags should be set according to if the parameter actually supports per note/id modulation.

**Computer Information
 - OS: win7/mac
 - Host: Custom host
 - Version: 0.0.1

title: Alt-Arrow key is quantized but not stepped
labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}, {'id': 3293667621, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwzMjkzNjY3NjIx', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Accessibility', 'name': 'Accessibility', 'color': '50BF51', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to making Surge more accessible'}]
body:
Chessel on discord says:

> No.  To go up one semitone I have to press up 8 times with control held down before it registers going up a semitone.  I just noted that alt + up arrow also takes 8 up arrow presses but settles on the intermediate values as it goes up whereas control ++ up arrow stays quantized on whole values.
> There is an additional querk where if you use control up arrow to go up a semitone, a single control down arrow will jump the whole semitone in one press.  but further control arrow down returns to the 8 keystrokes required behaviour.

What is happening is the alt is quantizing the move but not changing the amount the move is applied. So you press up and you get jogged the same amount as if alt isn't down, but that doesn't update until you jog 'enough'. Sigh.

May be tricky to fix since that quantization jog distance isn't advertised by a param. But toss it into 112 anyway.

title: Scene and oscillator keybinds should be announced
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 3293667621, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwzMjkzNjY3NjIx', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Accessibility', 'name': 'Accessibility', 'color': '50BF51', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to making Surge more accessible'}]
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**

I am frustrated when I am not sure which scene I am in or which oscillator I have selected if I am in another section of the synth.
While using Surge I would very much like the alt + s shortcuts for scenes. Alt + 1/2/3 for oscillators. used speech synthesis to tell what the status of the selection is.
Alt + s scene 1 / scene2. Alt + 1/2/3 changes the oscillator. If you are in another section like LFO I don't know after minutes if I am in one scene or another. Also for the oscillator.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

It would be very useful while working if the screen reader would announce the selected scene or oscillator via the shortcuts.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**

If it is easier to develop. For shortcuts, the Windows sapi 5 system speech is also good. More useful if the screen reader announced it.
Thank you!

body:
Over in #6584 I made block size variable

Everything works at 8, 16 and 32 except nimbus at 8

This is because nimbus has a resampling bug where if the first resample generates less than 8 blocks it never calls nimbus

This is why nimbus works in 16 and 32.

So you know, fix that! But do it separately. I want to get this diff out to people ahead of that fix (and into the rack codebase too!)
milestone.title: Surge XT 1.1.2

title: Towards a Variable Block Size
body:
This diff

1. Makes the BLOCK_SIZE something you can set form CMake at compile time
2. Fixes the associated half rate filter problems
3. Confirms oscillators, filters, waveshapers, FM work
4. Fixes the copy_block error which resulted in Combulator, Resonator,
   RingModulate nd Waveshaper effect
5. Fix Delay and Distortion due to mis-coded basic_dsp for small blocks
6. More basic_dsp fixes for small blocks
7. Nimbus doesn't work in block size 8; merge and fix separately

title: Display CPU load on VU meter
body:
An approximation to CPU load is displayed on the VU meter. On my dev machine the value shown accurately reflects the ability of the synth to accurately render/process the specified sound. The value is smoothed out with a running average and has falloff but it still changes very quickly. 

Related issue #6576

body:
**Bug Description:**
Playing very many notes with multiple sine OSC with unison voices will produce a lot of clicking/fuzz/digitial distortion.

**Surge XT Version**
Surge XT 1.0.1.60228e8
64 bit
Stand alone executable

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Initialize patch
2. Set OSC 1 to Modern/Sine, Unison Voices -> 16
3. Set OSC 2 to Modern/Sine, Unison Voices -> 16
4. Set Amp EG release to a high value (0.3s or higher)
5. Play as many note as possible for a 5+seconds.

**Expected Behavior:**
The sound produced by pressing the first key should not be significantly different then the sound produced when pressing later keys.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
Windows 10 - 64bit
Stand alone executable ("Surge XT.exe")

**Additional Information**
Surge is utilizing about 25% of CPU during this process

Copy with mod paste with mod didn't undo the mod properly.

by making the past with mod gesture equivalent to a patch change
push.

Addresses #6448

body:
Critically this makes the voiceover menu command and
shift-f10 symmetric on all the various overlay buttons
most importantly the ones in the FX area

title: Update the crossfade example
body: To use a correct power law. Thanks to user Chris S on KVR

title: Properly Scale the Waveshaper Effect
body:
The Waveshaper Effect was mis-scaled relative to the in-voice
waveshapers so exhibited a different response. This was because
of the network of up and down samples and various other factors
but it made it seem pretty broken. Now it meets the consdtraint
that sin -> filterbank -> output and sin -> fxunit -> output
respond the same on a same shaper at same drive.

Closes #6565

title: Waveshaper effect shapes severely borked
labels: [{'id': 1178867708, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY3NzA4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/DSP', 'name': 'DSP', 'color': 'e881ef', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth'}, {'id': 2152171733, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTUyMTcxNzMz', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Effects', 'name': 'Effects', 'color': 'ff38f8', 'default': False, 'description': ''}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
In the FX

1: The waveshapes are listed out-of-order.

2: What's worse, the majority of them aren't nearly correct.

Like, here are some (admittedly ugly) transfer graphs.
Sine shape:
![Sine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/105538426/186127724-c25307ec-800c-4415-9903-d58e6e527ec8.png)
OJD shape:
![OJD](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/105538426/186127734-79a440c4-b7d9-4a92-9630-dd2d4494e66b.png)


I haven't analyzed all of them, but just some quick listening reveals that while some of them seem to match by name, others aren't even close.
It seems possible that some of them are just mislabeled. But comparing the out-of-order-ness with the mismatched-ness doesn't reveal any obvious pattern. It just seems really random which ones sound identical and which ones sound completely off.

We had a bunch of lambdas which referenced 'this' rather than
'that = SafePointer' for callbacks on timers and I think
perhaps one of those is what caused the very occasional crash-on
close in reaper reported in #6421 so review them and push a change.

Keep the issue open for a bit while we look for crashes tho

Escape-closing surge with the patch menu open would segv because we didn't
do the safe pointer thing. We really need to do that everywhere (See
Closes #6558

title: Fix a problem in FX about param position assumption
body:
The FX unit assumed &FxStorage == &FxStorage->type in one spot, which it had since epoch, but with the addition of a member at the top of the class, that assumption broke, and blammeroonie.

So do three things

1. Fix that assumption in SurgeFXProcessor
2. Move the new member to the end of the class just in case. Like we need to clean up the rack client which may do the same. And
3. Add a big honkin comment explaning this

Closes #7052

Hi after this https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/7050,

title: What shall i do after compiling lv2 package on Arch
labels: [{'id': 2559447786, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyNTU5NDQ3Nzg2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/User%20Support%20Request', 'name': 'User Support Request', 'color': 'abbf18', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues where users are looking for help, not development items'}, {'id': 2877964229, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyODc3OTY0MjI5', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Discussion', 'name': 'Discussion', 'color': 'd0c509', 'default': False, 'description': ''}]
body:
Hi to all,

and thanks for this great synth.
I'm configuring my digital workstation with some software and i want to test surge.
I'm running arch linux with pipewire and pipewire jack clients.
I wanted to test some synth so i decided to test also vst3 plugin in Carla. When i find your synth i discovered that there was an lv2 version so i compiled it with cmake.

```
git clone https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge.git
cd surge/
git submodule update --init --recursive
cmake -Bbuildlv2 -DSURGE_BUILD_LV2=TRUE
cmake --build buildlv2 --config Release --target surge-staged-assets
```


```

[100%] Linking CXX shared module "surge-fx_artefacts/Release/LV2/Surge XT Effects.lv2/libSurge XT Effects.so"
surge-fx: Relocating LV2 component
[100%] Built target surge-fx_LV2
[100%] Built target surge-fx_Packaged
[100%] Built target surge-staged-assets
```
Now what can i do? I have to copy the compiledi directory in `usr/share` or in the lv2 dir plugin which carla use to scan plugins?
Where is the lv2 plugin?
Where can i have to copy the assets?

Sorry for this question, but this is the first time i compiled some software from source with cmake
Thanks

title: Tuning editor - editing number of notes
labels: [{'id': 1178866610, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY2NjEw', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UI', 'name': 'UI', 'color': '963715', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to UI look&feel'}, {'id': 1505910927, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTA1OTEwOTI3', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Tuning', 'name': 'Tuning', 'color': '027039', 'default': False, 'description': 'Non-standard tuning extensions'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
If I change the 'number of degrees' line in the tuning editor, then when a note is played, the editor highlights the wrong note in the text, and plays the old scale length.

**Surge XT Version**
Version: Surge XT 1.2.nightly.cb11acd
Build: 2023-04-09 @ 23:14:19 on 'fv-az33-642/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.29.30148.0' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Windows 64-bit Standalone on Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700HQ CPU @ 2.80GHz
Sample Rate: 44.1 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Drag "SD2 10-05.scl" into Surge
2. Open the editor
3. Decrement the degree count (e.g. from 5 to 4)
4. Delete the first ratio, leaving 4 entries.
5. Play notes. They highlight correctly in the VK (based on MIDI IN) at the left of the tuning editor, but the sound is a 5-note scale (should be 4), and the wrong notes highlight in the editor.

**Expected Behavior:**
When I play the notes, I expect those entries to be highlighted.

**Additional Information:**
I'm debugging my own app that generates .scl files, and came across this bug. I can reproduce it with the .scl files provided with Surge, so provided that as a clean example and avoid external factors.

body:
Fixes #7044
and implementation of undo/redo for XYControl widget in Filter Analysis

title: Various parameter and naming adjustments for Bonsai
body:
Bass Distort is now in 0-100%
Bias Filter modes now don't mention "type x"
Dist Mode is now called Type with nice user-friendly names
Noise Gain is not asymmeteric nor extendable anymore
Input and output gain are both just named Gain to comply to other Surge effects
Removed two custom ctypes and replaced them with existing ones instead

title: The XY point in FilterAnalysis window doesn't update VST parameters in a plugin host
labels: [{'id': 1178866610, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY2NjEw', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UI', 'name': 'UI', 'color': '963715', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to UI look&feel'}, {'id': 1829056442, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODI5MDU2NDQy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Host%20Automation', 'name': 'Host Automation', 'color': 'fbca04', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to DAW (host) automation'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Them moving the point in FilterAnalysis window it affects the sound, but it doesn't update the parameters in plugin's host.
Checked as VST3 and CLAP. 



**Surge XT Version**

* Version:1.2.0
* Plugin Type: [VST2, VST3, AU, CLAP]
* Bitness: [64-bit]

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add Surge as VST2 plugin. 
2. Open Filter Analysis window
3. Move the point to apply cutoff filter
4. Observe that filter is working, but the host doesn't see the VST params are changed 

**Expected behavior:**
We should see the VST params of filter are also changed in the host so that we can control automation correctly, for example.

**Screenshots:**
![GIF Recording 2023-06-05 at 7 33 04 PM](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/31346594/d978821a-0d5e-45e3-8ae3-9e4e58f1f29d)
milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

title: More explicit PI32 bail out; tweak README
body: If you are on 32 bit and not on windows, fatal error in the CMake

title: Update README (and a CMake if) for RPi and LV2/Juce 7
body: Mostly documentation but also change the buildLV2 condition to be more robust now we have Juce 7.

title: Migrate no icon alerts in SurgeGUIEditor and add OverlayUtils for drawing windows
body:
Following up on https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/pull/7037 
Moving a couple more alertOkCancels to the custom overlay and adding utility for the code to draw the window as discussed in the above pull request. Having the Alert and MiniEdit overlays use this - though subsequently other overlays may use this as well. My preference for the implementation of this is as a utility method, but I'm happy to add an abstraction layer instead if you prefer. We could also add more common code for buttons etc to this in the next PRs.

Questions:

1. Thoughts on standardizing between "Ok"/"Cancel" and "Yes"/"No" for these? This PR uses only the former - if we want to definitely allow both, I'll update this PR. 
2. Could you point me to how to test all the changes for this? I love this synth but I am new to it so I've never used the functionality this PR edits. 

Additionally - I'll be travelling starting tomorrow mid-day Seattle/US time and will be back Monday. So it will be difficult for me to contribute during this time. Next week however, I should be able to continue work on this and look at some of the short circuit work pointed to in discord.

title: Save per-instance MTS-ESP disconnect in DAW extra state
labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1178866610, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY2NjEw', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UI', 'name': 'UI', 'color': '963715', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to UI look&feel'}, {'id': 1505910927, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTA1OTEwOTI3', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Tuning', 'name': 'Tuning', 'color': '027039', 'default': False, 'description': 'Non-standard tuning extensions'}]
body:
William Fields requested this on Discord in order to have drum Surges not change when the tuning changes (but still make use of normal pitch bend so keytrack disabling is no good). It could be useful in other situations too surely, so why not. 

Proposal: Besides passing the necessary info to DAW extra state, rename the "disconnect as client..." option to "Ignore MTS-ESP for this instance" and give that a checkmark. That should hopefully help clarify the difference between the global and local option.

body:

Since it's my first pull request for surge, let me know if there's any process I haven't followed. Attached screenshot of the alert box.

User testing by creating/deleting patches multiple times. Checked functionality for both Okay and Cancel.

title: AMP EG - too fast???
labels: [{'id': 2877964229, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyODc3OTY0MjI5', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Discussion', 'name': 'Discussion', 'color': 'd0c509', 'default': False, 'description': ''}]
body:
Hi, having questions about the Amp EG in the standalone version 

Version: Surge XT 1.2.git-no-branch.git-no-commit
Build: 2023-04-12 @ 00:00:00 on 'hci-snode2-m0/local' with 'GNU-13.0.1' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Linux 64-bit Standalone on  Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8700 CPU @ 3.20GHz
Sample Rate: 44.1 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples

I am trying to reverse engineer the Factory Pad "Canadians" into the VCV Rack version. After not getting the same 'noise' between the two synths I noticed that the standalone version does something 'weird'. The AMP EG has an attack value of ~1.5secs. But as soon as I press a note on the keyboard the volume is nearly max immediately.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14888092/236718946-af04ee54-b9a2-4d10-b9d3-2caa0a0a7b07.mp4

Whereas in my Rack equivalent I get an attack time I expect -

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14888092/236720149-04e24ff2-1c11-47b2-bfa7-4bab3ed08c47.mp4

Either the attack on the standalone's AMP EG is wrong OR I am misunderstanding the signal path in Surge and my VCV patch is wrong. I have read the manual's technical stuff (honestly!) but I am curious as to why the standalone attck is so fast.

title: Surge / Surge-XT attack resolution from MIDI controller Nektar impact LX49+
labels: [{'id': 1241135991, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMjQxMTM1OTkx', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/MIDI', 'name': 'MIDI', 'color': '41d0e0', 'default': False, 'description': 'MIDI support related'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Attack resolution is only 1 bit when MIDI control is assigned to controller CC#38

**Surge XT Version**
1.2.2.832c875

* Version:
* Plugin Type: [VST3]
* Bitness: [64-bit]

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Right click on the Attack controller in the Filter EG section and learn from MIDI controller.
2. On Nektar Impact LX49+, use the first slider (called attack)


**Expected Behavior:**
A expect the slider to travel from bottom to top in correspondence to the controller.  It does not.  It only moves 1 bit, from 0 to 1.  I have confirmed the controller itself is fine as my DAW (Renoise) can see full 128 bit resolution coming from the same physical control.

labels: [{'id': 1064039352, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDY0MDM5MzUy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Feature%20Request', 'name': 'Feature Request', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': False, 'description': 'New feature request'}, {'id': 1178866610, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY2NjEw', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UI', 'name': 'UI', 'color': '963715', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to UI look&feel'}]
body:
To jog your memory

- Surge < 1.2.0 block size not multiple of 32, corrupted audio, no warning, no resolution
- Surge > 1.2.0 block size not multiple of 32, make input latent, don't corrupt but
     - 1.2.0 - splash a massive modal error on the screen whether you use it or not
     - 1.2.1 - draw a small warning over every osc whether the osc uses it or not
     - 1.2.2 - draw a small warning over the audio in oscillator and nowhere else

Clearly there's some goldilocksing happening here. What we want in 1.3 is the 1.2.2 solution but also:

- [x] For Alias oscillator if Audio In mode is selected
- [x] For String oscillator if Audio In mode is selected
- [x] For Vocoder effect... *somewhere*

The primary goal of the 1.2.x was to avoid the massive modal screen; these tweaks can wait until a 1.3.

title: ParamMetaData and new FX
labels: [{'id': 1178865465, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY1NDY1', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Code%20Refactoring', 'name': 'Code Refactoring', 'color': '9155c6', 'default': False, 'description': 'General code refactoring and cleanup issues like names, unused variables, warnings, fixme'}, {'id': 1571077334, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTcxMDc3MzM0', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Infrastructure', 'name': 'Infrastructure', 'color': '0c2a6d', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to repository, CI/CD, installers, etc.'}]
body:
Still left to do here

- [ ] temposync (quite pressingly since flanger and r1 are currently broken)
- [ ] absolute
- [ ] extend scales 
-----

The new FX (and presumably in the future the new OSC) have `set::basic_blocks::params::ParamMetaData` to describe the params.

So imagine if this added a few things like `canDeactivate` `canExtend` etc... and also added `withUnits` and then `std::string toString(f)` and `optional<float> fromString(const std::string &)` methods

then `Parmeter` can pick up a `std::optional<ParamMedatData>`which is set to `{}` every time you call `set_type` but is reset to the PMD in the post-init-ctrltypes param metadata copy in the FX (and in the future the OSC) and then to_string and from_string could move here.

Similarly with modulation depths.

You get the idea.

title: Osc->init ignored octave; commit changes sound.
body:
SurgeVoice called osc->init with a pitch which ignored the octave offset and so forth. This meant that the first block of any oscillator with octave +3 would have a 3 octave immediate shift.

This long lived bug (since inception) is audible in the String and (far less so) Modern oscillators which have a variety of memory and smoothing in their handling of pitch.

This will subtly change the sound of oscillators with high octaves, but will change it to be correct.

Closes #6985

title: setting portamento time to 0ms stilll produces pitch slides in single trigger play modes
labels: [{'id': 1218170928, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMjE4MTcwOTI4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Modulation', 'name': 'Modulation', 'color': 'c97f2a', 'default': False, 'description': 'Modulation related issues'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
If a portamento time of 0ms is used, and the scene play mode is set to one of the single trigger options, there is still a subtle slide between notes. This slide is absent when using non single trigger play modes i.e. 0ms is truly instantaneous, but it of course does not quite sound the same as single trigger.

I first noticed this with linear curve and all other portamento options unchecked. I was advised by a user on the Discord to try checking constant rate and using logarithmic curve shape, since in their testing at least, this was a bit better. However, all settings will still produce a slide. Furthermore very large note jumps (a few octaves or more), have longer slides with constant rate checked than unchecked, even if the portamento time is kept at 0ms.

At first I thought this was a design limitation of the oscillators, and for string and modern types this indeed seems to be the case as they will quickly ramp/slide when performing pitch change by any means. However all other osc types can be forced into extreme, non-ramped pitch changes with lfos, or modulation from CC (if midi smoothing is disabled), so most oscs seem capable of instant portamento.

Make one of them absolute pitch, but keep its pitch at 0.

title: Pitch type-ins are a tiny bit borked with "Apply tuning after modulation"
labels: [{'id': 1505910927, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxNTA1OTEwOTI3', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Tuning', 'name': 'Tuning', 'color': '027039', 'default': False, 'description': 'Non-standard tuning extensions'}, {'id': 1829061756, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxODI5MDYxNzU2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/UX', 'name': 'UX', 'color': '42d9f7', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.'}, {'id': 2877964229, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyODc3OTY0MjI5', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Discussion', 'name': 'Discussion', 'color': 'd0c509', 'default': False, 'description': ''}]
body:
So... you have loaded a tuning with a 3/2 in it, and checked the mentioned option. You type-in "3/2" in the pitch field of an oscillator, it won't play 3/2. 

That's because with apply after modulation checked, putting pitch to 7.00 exactly is remapped to 7 keys up, and typing in 3/2 doesn't land you on 7 steps it lands you on 7.02. 

So you probably expected to land on 3/2 since that's what you typed in, and that interval is in your scale. But instead you landed a bit sharp of the 7th degree in your scale. How sharp depends on what the 8th degree is, since this mode interpolates the pitches between the integer degrees.

There are two options for solving this. Either we just document it as it is, basically saying "in this mode, always type in pitch offsets as 100 cent intervals. 

...or make it so whenever the user types in a ratio that's present in the scale, make sure the param ends in the place that actually makes that sound. 

The latter would be more intuitive in some cases. But of course, it'd still only be when playing the root of the scale that you'd actually be guaranteed to hear the interval you typed in.

title: Reorder PatchDB operations on rename
body:
The patcdb rename would look like save / delete / update but the save had a patch db update in it of course. So the delete on unix would delete underneath the patch importer and the importer is not robust under that condition (#6973). Fixing that is hard, so rather than fix that today open an issue for it and instead have the rename look like save+update / drain queue / delete+update and then no more lock.

Closes #6959

body:
**Bug Description:**
Oneshot Factory WTs are no longer oneshots after moving to assuming 1024 frames when loading a WAV file without loop metadata.

**Surge XT Version**
Version: Surge XT 1.2.main.d57eed25
Build: 2023-04-17 @ 23:02:03 on 'rainbow/local' with 'Clang-15.0.7' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Linux 64-bit VST3 on  AMD Ryzen 7 2700X Eight-Core Processor
Host: Ardour @ 96.0 kHz / Process block size: 8 samples

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Select a WT oscillator
2. Load Factory Wavetables -> Oneshot -> [any of them]
3. Notice it's not a oneshot anymore, but a WT with 1024 frames.

**Expected Behavior:**
Oneshots are still oneshots.

**Additional Information:**
A proper fix for importing WAVs without loop information is issue #3436 but until then we should patch the factory files to have the correct metadata.

title: Rename user preset appears database lock error
labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}, {'id': 3248300442, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwzMjQ4MzAwNDQy', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Patch%20Browser', 'name': 'Patch Browser', 'color': '6CD57B', 'default': False, 'description': ''}]
body:
1. Rename a user preset and save
2. The error appears: PatchDB - Loading Favorites SQL Error[5]. Database is locked (This Error appears two times immediataly)
3. After confirm, the preset is finally renamed
4. If i want to perform now the following i got the same error: PatchDB - SQL Error[5]. Database is locked (without the "Loading Favorites"), and this time up to 20+ times immediataly, that i have to confirm now
- save a new preset, delete a preset, favorite a preset
- again after confirming all the errors, the action was performed, and i see the favorite, the preset is deleted or a new is created!
- Refresh patch browser doesn't help
- Restart the surge standalone session or the DAW host helps and all actions can performed without an error as long as no preset rename is performed! Then the error appears again for all the actions above!

* Version: Linux x64 Verison 1.1.2, 1.2.0, and the nightly downloaded on 2023.04.18
* Plugin Type: VST3, Clap, LV2 in Reaper and Standalone

 - OS: openSUSE Tumbleweed 20230413, amd64
 - Host: Reaper 6.73
- Another User has the same issue in Arch Linux too.

title: Window grows larger every time it's reopened in Cubase
labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
Every time I close then re-open an instance of Surge XT, the size of the window increases.

**Surge XT Version**
Version: Surge XT 1.2.0.cb11acd
Build: 2023-04-10 @ 13:12:17 on 'fv-az238-859/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.29.30148.0' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Windows 64-bit VST3 on AMD Ryzen 9 5950X 16-Core Processor            
Host: Steinberg Cubase @ 48.0 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples

Above was copy-pastaed from Surge XT's version info.

Additionally: I'm running Cubase 12 on Windows 10.

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. In Cubase, select an instrument track containing an instance of Surge XT
2. In the inspector on the left-hand side, click 'edit instrument' to re-open the instance of Surge XT
3. Exit the instance, and re-open it, it should be zoomed in larger than last time.
4. Repeat until it covers an area larger than your desktop resolution.

**Expected Behavior:**
I expected the window to be the same size as last time, not bigger.

I'm holding off on the screenshots because... it's the same thing. But bigger. I'm also not sure about the possibility it's just my DAW, I feel like I would've been able to find a previously reported closed issue at least mentioning it. None of my other VST3 plugins exhibit this sort of behavior.

labels: [{'id': 1178858594, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODU4NTk0', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Host%20Specific', 'name': 'Host Specific', 'color': '95e008', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to specific host(s) or host features'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}, {'id': 3879582117, 'node_id': 'LA_kwDOCOvoes7nPbml', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/CLAP', 'name': 'CLAP', 'color': 'F120E8', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to CLAP plugin format'}]
body:
Congrats on the recent release!

In Bitwig 5 Beta 2, on Windows 10, on an Intel i7-3770 CPU, I've loaded two different projects previously saved in Bitwig 4.3.10, including tracks created with Surge XT v1.1 (one project) and v1.2.0 (the other project), CLAP version, 64-bit. When I open the projects with Bitwig 5 Beta 2, the instance(s) of Surge won't load properly. Each instance of Surge yields the message, "Could not load plug-in. Could not load initial plug-in state: Couldn't load the plugin state".

Attempting to reload the plug-in doesn't help. The only option is to load a new instance of Surge XT, but this results in losing any Bitwig modulators that were assigned to the existing instance of the synth.

I've also tried reinstalling Surge XT 1.2.0, and that didn't help (although Surge still opens fine in Bitwig 4.3.10).

I've reported this issue to Bitwig tech support as well.

title: Add a few more Wavetables

title: LFO parameter sliders blinking
body:
When we click on another modulation source button, we change `modsource_editor[i] = newsource` and `queue_refresh = true;`. Doing that we cause recreating all sliders. But we also repaint some components that cause repainting the sliders of the modulation source and we have that blinking. To prevent that, I set `needsModUpdate = true;` instead of calling `refresh_mod()` so that 'refresh_mod()' would only cause one repainting. 
Issue: https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/6889

title: MSEG Constant Segments trigger properly
body:
MSEG Constant segments have an optimization to skip most of the calculation which is great. But it avoices updating an internal state about triggers meaning a segment would fire a trigger on every sample if exactly constant. Update the evaluation time state to make sure we know we are beyond the trigger.

Closes #6915

title: MSEG trigs misfire if segment is flat
labels: [{'id': 1178867708, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY3NzA4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/DSP', 'name': 'DSP', 'color': 'e881ef', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth'}, {'id': 1218170928, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMjE4MTcwOTI4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Modulation', 'name': 'Modulation', 'color': 'c97f2a', 'default': False, 'description': 'Modulation related issues'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
If an MSEG segment is set up to fire the AEG and/or FEG, and the segment is completely flat, it will fire the trigs at the end of the segment instead of the beginning. 

Confirmed by:
Pinning a few MSEG segments to the top of the screen
set one to fire AEG
make AEG with 0 sustain
assign the MSEG to something inconsequential 
latch. 

Then move the end point of the segment up and down, and pay attention to the timing of the ping. It's tricky to hear in isolation, but you will hear that the ping moves from the start to the end of the segment when it's flat at the top.

title: Vintage Ladder CPU Spikes with non-simd-length notes in F2 slot after wave shaper
labels: [{'id': 1178867708, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY3NzA4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/DSP', 'name': 'DSP', 'color': 'e881ef', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
Discord user Trace98 reports April 5 in surge bug reports

```
Trace98  Yesterday at 6:55 PM
Hello, 
-using Vintage Ladder (Type 1 not Type 2) in filter 2, in any configuration where the filter comes after an active waveshaper
using one of the following
 (soft medium hard ojd sine add13 add15 addsqr3 full rect halfpos halfneg sft1fold 1fold 2fold wcfold and from sin+x onward)
causes the cpu to spike up to 100 immediately.
Adding to the weirdness the bug doesn't happen when pressing 3 or more notes simultaneously at the same time;
it only happens when pressing 1 or 2 notes, after the bug manifests adding other ntoes won't fix it.
Sometimes it doesn't happen instantly, it takes a moment or some note ons, but after it happens it stays there
-Reaper v6.78, Win 10,  both CLAP and VST3, latest surge nightly 1.2.nightly.7473f5e (bug happened even in b6c8442)
baconpaul  Yesterday at 7:00 PM
Are you in stereo routing? If you put it in mono routing does the problem resolve with 5 notes?
The vintage ladders are deterministic not iterative so something must be either causing a nan or under flow
(but we have software denormals off)
Trace98  Yesterday at 7:05 PM
it's a bit weird, i'm testing a bit
by mono routing you mean every routing but wide and l-r right?
baconpaul  Yesterday at 7:06 PM
Yeah like s1 is perfect
Trace98  Yesterday at 7:08 PM
yeah happens there too
with 1 2 3 5 5 7 notes simultaneously
with 4 or 8 notes it resolves
it's hard to track everything, now when switching between modes the bug persisted. it's very erratic
baconpaul  Yesterday at 7:15 PM
Great can you save your crashing patch as an fxp so I can try it?
```

my theory is that the model is getting an inactive voice in the simd slot (as all models do) but something about the model and un-initialized is making it run away or nan out.

[VintageLadderCPUBug.fxp.zip](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/files/11158754/VintageLadderCPUBug.fxp.zip)

title: User Defaults Issue
labels: [{'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
**Bug Description:**
There seems to be an issue with filesystem access in Surge XT in Windows 10. I have encountered a number of problems:

1. could not create a "Surge XT" folder under C:\users\<me>\Documents
2. could not open SurgeXTUserDefaults.xml for writing when switching skins from the default to Surge Dark
3. Exception occurred while creating category folder when saving any preset. 

**Surge XT Version**

* Version: 1.1.2d3568a9 also NIGHTLY-2023-03-21-06a6c9e
* Plugin Type: CLAP, also standalone
* Bitness: 64 bit

**Reproduction Steps:**

1. install Surge XT from the main website
2. launch Surge XT from the start menu
3. observe the first error, unable to create Surge XT folder in C:\users\<me>\Documents

1. create a Surge XT folder manually (if this is not done, Surge crashes upon selection of the skin)
2. click the menu button and select "Skins...Surge Dark"
3. observe the error "could not open SurgeXTUserDefaults.xml for writing"
4. create a SurgeXTUserDefaults.xml manually
5. close Surge XT
6. reopen Surge XT, notice that the skin is back to the default
7. attempt to change the skin to Surge Dark again, observe the error once more
8. notice that the manually created SurgeXTUserDefaults.xml is still 0 bytes

1. in the main Surge XT window, click "Save"
2. change the category from "Templates" to "abc"
3. leave the name "Init Saw"
4. change Author to "abc"
5. click save, observe the error "Exception occurred while creating category! Most likely, invalid characters were used to name the category..."
6. click ok

**OTHER STEPS**

1. click the patch name to open the patch browser
2. under Functions, click open user patches folder
3. nothing happens
4. click "open factory patches folder" 
5. observe that the factory patches folder opens

**Expected Behavior:**

1. expected user folder to be created
2. expected user defaults file to be created
3. expected to be able to switch skins permanently
4. expected to be able to save user patches
5. expected to be able to open the user patches folder from the patches browser

**Screenshots:**
If applicable, add screenshots/GIF/videos to help explain your problem.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13843226/227028720-926e37c8-9dbe-43fc-a16a-e6fc5953cad9.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13843226/227028772-451b337a-4bf7-4967-b2c7-63a720bcb570.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13843226/227028803-141b25a4-20f1-4794-85f7-68910d62cc2c.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13843226/227028847-9c02347a-c7b1-4e44-8cfd-f202909b8410.png)

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10 Home version 22H2 build 19045.2728
 - Host: REAPER, standalone
 - Version: 6.78 win64 rev f121cd

**Additional Information:**
I guess this covers it.

title: Weird alias when modulating mixer at Block size 8
labels: [{'id': 1178867708, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODY3NzA4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/DSP', 'name': 'DSP', 'color': 'e881ef', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth'}, {'id': 1218170928, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMjE4MTcwOTI4', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Modulation', 'name': 'Modulation', 'color': 'c97f2a', 'default': False, 'description': 'Modulation related issues'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:
Build Surge at Block_Size=8, 
Make osc1 a Sine osc (makes it easy to hear the issue)
Attach an LFO to osc1 mixer slider
Play a bass note and bring the LFO rate up.
You'll hear an alias-like ringing that gets louder as LFO rate increases.

Curiously, the frequency of the ringing is constant no matter what note you play, and no matter what the LFO rate is; only its amplitude changes. It seems rooted at around 6k.

And also curiously, if you oversample this block size-8 Surge, the frequency changes as expected (goes to 12k at 2x OS etc), but if you use the default block size 32, the problem dissappears from consequential ranges. Introducing some totally overkill treble boost CPU, it does seem like a similar ringing might actually be present also at BS=32, but it's much much quieter. I would've never found it if I wasn't trying to. 

Dropping this in XT2 for now.

Closes #6524

title: Add an errorType enum; use it to report latency shift.
body:
1. Add a SurgeStorage::ErrorType enum which goes with reportError and defaults to GENERAL_ERROR
2. Call reportError with AUDIO_CONFIGURATION from the new resize
3. When we get that in SurgeGUIEditor, do nothing. Oh well! Maybe later we will do something.

Addresses #6524

title: Start work on Input with non-block-size blocks
body:
Input with block-size-not-multiple-of-BLOCK_SIZE blocks would distort in all platforms. This begins to fix it for the VST3 and AU with the VST3 being most important, since FL does this all the time.

What we do here is: if a block is handed to us with a non-multiple of BLOCK_SIZE we just start lagging the input. We don't turn on latent processing in the synth, we don't do it in the CLAP, and we don't show a user error. Clearly this requires more thought but it will stop randomly distorted and crashing behavior, at least, in the case where you don't have uniform blocks.

Addresses #6524

title: Dismiss any active menus in ~SGE
body: SurgeGuiEditor destructor dismisses any active menus in case you close by some mechanism. Reaper Ctrl-W with a window open would do this often. Closes #6796

title: Add a defensive clamp to airwindows name lookup
body:
I think theres a tiny race condition which means a parameter can have an airwindows paramter mapper on a non-airwindows parameter when changing presets while notes are playing, as described in proper rebuild, so XT2, but for now add a bit of defense on range vs the static data structure.

Addresses #6619

Use MSEG Panel skin color for parameter area background
Larger font used for sliders, like in the rest of the GUI

title: Truncated WT Files no longer add noise
body:
Truncated WT files would silently fill the end of the buffer with noise. This was actually a problem for oneshot/Pulse which advertises 3 tables but has 2. Clearly some old semantic where this would have worked is either ignore the last or fill with zero, so replace the fixme which was sitting here with a fill-with-zero. This will also fix
https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/843 when all merged through.

title: Clamp all Twist parameters
Add a decay to the spectrum view
Guard against division by zero opportunities.
body: It hasn't happened even when I tried forcing it, but it's worth being a little proactive and making sure it never happens.

title: Enable "freeze" parameter for spectrum viewer.
Don't set overlay wrapper to opaque background
body: Gives full control to the skin color `editor.overlay.background` regarding opacity

title: Adjust init values for Delay and Reverb 1
body: ...so that the FX plugin doesn't instantiate with delay at 100% mix :)

title: FX Mode handles block mod buffers better
body:
In the event we are in non-latent mode and our buffer is not a multiple of block size, then

1: reset the inputs and outputs
2: Enter latent mode
3: set latency and
4: inform the host of a latency change

Addresses #6638 but some testing before we close it would be super.

title: Alias Editor Accesibility Tweaks
body:
1. The CustomEdit has the right "size" so it works in tab traversal
2. The Menu/Right Bracket callbacks all work
3. Enter on CustomEdit butto activated

Closes #6822

title: Accesibility Quantized Arrow Keys with Command
body:
1. Make 'Command' the Quantized key consistently in ally and mouse
2. Actually respond to it in the modulatable slider, albeit with a pretty hacky way (see the comment there)
3. Fix a problem with size-one wavetables and quantized drags

Closes #6593

title: Stop runaway modulators on extreme changes
body:
In extreme (really computer generated) midi sequences you could force the modulator smoother to runaway since in one case it would push you outside of [target,value] when interpolating. Fix that with a clamp; and add an assert in case theres other future problems.

Closes #6835

labels: [{'id': 1178858594, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODU4NTk0', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Host%20Specific', 'name': 'Host Specific', 'color': '95e008', 'default': False, 'description': 'Issues related to specific host(s) or host features'}, {'id': 1178875483, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMTc4ODc1NDgz', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Windows', 'name': 'Windows', 'color': 'e99695', 'default': False, 'description': 'Windows related issues'}, {'id': 1212863779, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMjEyODYzNzc5', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/VST3', 'name': 'VST3', 'color': '205d8c', 'default': False, 'description': 'VST3 plugin related issues'}, {'id': 2176487016, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMTc2NDg3MDE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/surge-synthesizer/surge/labels/Bug%20Report', 'name': 'Bug Report', 'color': '1d76db', 'default': False, 'description': 'Item submitted using the Bug Report template'}]
body:

milestone.description:
Guess we are doing a 1.2!
